creator: jp@fiset.ca
text:
Currently, PatternSet.hasPatterns() is protected, allowinf FileSet to query if a
pattern set has been populated. However, custom filesets attempting to reuse the
PatternSet class do not have access to this method.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
possible workaround: You should have indirect access to this method via 
AbstractFileSet.hasPatterns(), ASSUMING that you are storing only 
includes/excludes patterns as usual.  If you are supporting other patterns, 
then you still need something more.

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
text:
Made it public,
thanks for the report.
